intro: Tylophora perakensis subsp. andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman star vine, is a climbing shrub native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by elliptical berries. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments and is often found in humid, shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
